concept.title: Configuring link aggregation by using the command line
concept.shortdesc: Aggregate interfaces correspond to the logical grouping of multiple Ethernet interfaces, connected to the same subnet, in order to provide higher levels of availability and bandwidth from the networking substrate. System administrators can configure link aggregation of their physical appliance by using the create, edit, list, reset, and delete commands on the command line.

conbody.p: To view the status of all aggregate interfaces or a specific aggregate interface, you can use the status command on the command line. You can enable or disable an aggregate interface by using the enable or disable command on the command line.

System administrators can also use the show properties command to view the configurable properties of an aggregate interface and the show command to view the current settings of an aggregate interface. You must be in edit aggregate-interface mode to use the show properties and show commands.
